fault_title: Outside Air Damper Stuck Closed (Economizer Ineffective)
symptoms: ma_temp remains close to ra_temp despite changes in oa_damper
sa_temp stays above sa_temp_sp; cooling demand persists
cc_valve opens higher than expected to compensate for lack of free cooling

window_pattern.trend_notes: oa_damper varies but ma_temp response is flat; sa_temp-sp remains positive

likely_root_cause: OA damper mechanically stuck near closed position (actuator seized or linkage jam).
verification_steps: Compare oa_damper command vs actual damper movement (visual/feedback)
Manually exercise damper linkage to confirm binding
Check actuator power/signal and end-stops
resolution_steps: Repair linkage or replace OA damper actuator
Recalibrate damper travel limits
Retest economizer operation under mild oa_temp
expected_post_fix_behavior: ma_temp should shift toward oa_temp when oa_damper opens
sa_temp should track sa_temp_sp with reduced cc_valve demand

fault_title: Outside Air Damper Stuck Open (Over-Ventilation / Unstable Mixed Air)
symptoms: oa_damper remains high and ma_temp trends toward oa_temp
sa_temp becomes harder to control; cc_valve opens aggressively to maintain sa_temp_sp
ma_temp shows larger swings than expected during stable ra_temp

window_pattern.trend_notes: ma_temp tracks oa_temp more than expected; cc_valve increases to offset warmer mixed air

likely_root_cause: OA damper stuck near open position due to actuator fault or linkage disengagement.
verification_steps: Check damper position feedback vs command
Inspect actuator linkage for disconnection
Confirm damper returns to commanded minimum position
resolution_steps: Reconnect/repair damper linkage
Replace faulty actuator if required
Verify minimum ventilation and economizer limits
expected_post_fix_behavior: oa_damper should modulate according to economizer/ventilation logic
ma_temp should remain between oa_temp and ra_temp without excessive swings

fault_title: Return Air Damper Stuck Open (Mixed Air Tracks Return Air)
symptoms: ma_temp closely tracks ra_temp across multiple windows
oa_damper changes have minimal effect on ma_temp
economizer benefit is lost; cc_valve compensates to reach sa_temp_sp

window_pattern.trend_notes: ma_temp-ra_temp remains near zero while oa_damper varies

likely_root_cause: RA damper mechanically stuck open (binding or failed actuator), overpowering OA control.
verification_steps: Inspect RA damper movement and linkage
Check if RA damper responds to manual override
Validate damper end-stop and actuator coupling
resolution_steps: Free the RA damper mechanism and lubricate as needed
Replace actuator/linkage components if worn
Functional test: ma_temp response to oa_damper modulation
expected_post_fix_behavior: ma_temp should respond when oa_damper increases/decreases
economizer should reduce cc_valve demand under suitable oa_temp

fault_title: Outside Air Damper Partially Jammed (Reduced Authority)
symptoms: oa_damper responds slightly but ma_temp response is weaker than expected
sa_temp approaches sa_temp_sp slowly; cc_valve remains elevated
mixed air control appears sluggish across successive windows

window_pattern.trend_notes: partial movement observed but mixed-air temperature change is muted

likely_root_cause: Damper mechanical friction/binding causing partial travel (wear, obstruction, misalignment).
verification_steps: Command step changes in oa_damper and observe physical travel
Inspect damper blades for obstruction or deformation
Check actuator torque and linkage alignment
resolution_steps: Remove obstruction and correct alignment
Service damper bearings/links; replace worn parts
Recommission damper travel and verify response
expected_post_fix_behavior: ma_temp should show clearer response to oa_damper changes
cc_valve demand should drop under favorable outdoor conditions

fault_title: Damper Stuck During Mild OAT (Subtle Economizer Loss)
symptoms: economizer opportunity exists but ma_temp does not move toward oa_temp
sa_temp maintains near setpoint but cc_valve stays higher than baseline
issue appears as energy inefficiency rather than comfort violation

window_pattern.trend_notes: comfort maintained, but cc_valve remains persistently elevated for mild oa_temp

likely_root_cause: Economizer damper stuck near minimum position; system relies on mechanical cooling.
verification_steps: Check economizer enable conditions and damper command
Verify damper movement at economizer enable
Compare cc_valve usage against normal-operation baseline
resolution_steps: Restore damper actuation and calibrate minimum/maximum positions
Verify economizer logic after repair
Monitor cc_valve reduction under mild outdoor air
expected_post_fix_behavior: cc_valve should reduce when economizer is available
ma_temp should move closer to oa_temp when economizer opens

fault_title: Cooling Coil Effectiveness Reduced (Valve High, SAT Not Meeting Setpoint)
symptoms: cc_valve rises to high levels but sa_temp remains above sa_temp_sp
avg_zone_temp gradually increases during the episode
cooling response is consistently weaker than normal

window_pattern.trend_notes: persistent positive sa_temp-sp with cc_valve near saturation

likely_root_cause: Cooling coil heat-transfer degradation (coil fouling or reduced chilled-water effectiveness).
verification_steps: Check for coil fouling/blocked fins (visual inspection)
Verify airflow across coil (filters, fan)
Confirm chilled-water availability (if instrumented)
resolution_steps: Clean cooling coil surfaces
Replace/clean filters and confirm airflow
Re-test SAT tracking after maintenance
expected_post_fix_behavior: sa_temp should approach sa_temp_sp with lower cc_valve levels
avg_zone_temp should stabilize or decline during cooling

fault_title: Gradual Cooling Degradation (Slow Response Over Multiple Windows)
symptoms: sa_temp slowly drifts above sa_temp_sp as cooling demand persists
cc_valve ramps upward over time to compensate
comfort impact appears after several windows (delayed)

window_pattern.trend_notes: progressive loss of cooling effectiveness; cc_valve trend upward

likely_root_cause: Cooling coil effectiveness gradually reduced (e.g., fouling buildup or reduced heat exchange).
verification_steps: Compare current SAT tracking to baseline windows
Inspect coil and filters for progressive fouling
Check for abnormal fan operation affecting airflow
resolution_steps: Schedule coil cleaning and filter replacement
Verify fan speed response and airflow
Post-fix: validate SAT tracking across multiple windows
expected_post_fix_behavior: cc_valve should stabilize at lower average levels
sa_temp should maintain closer tracking to sa_temp_sp

symptoms: cc_valve remains near maximum for extended duration
sa_temp fails to reach sa_temp_sp during peak load
avg_zone_temp rises despite increased cooling effort

window_pattern.trend_notes: cc_valve saturation with persistent SAT error during high outdoor load

likely_root_cause: Cooling capacity insufficient at coil (effectiveness loss or insufficient chilled-water cooling).
verification_steps: Verify coil cleanliness and airflow restrictions
Check whether cooling performance improves during lower loads
Validate valve stroke and actuator response
resolution_steps: Clean coil and restore airflow path
Service valve/actuator if stroke is limited
Rebalance system and verify SAT control at peak load
expected_post_fix_behavior: cc_valve should modulate (not saturate) under similar load
sa_temp should reduce closer to setpoint with improved capacity

fault_title: Airflow-Limited Cooling (Fan Up, Cooling Still Weak)
symptoms: sa_fan_speed elevated but sa_temp remains above sa_temp_sp
cc_valve increases without proportional SAT improvement
cooling appears limited by heat transfer/airflow interaction

window_pattern.trend_notes: fan speed increases slightly but SAT error persists; cc_valve remains high

likely_root_cause: Effective cooling reduced due to airflow path issues (filters, coil blockage) affecting heat exchange.
verification_steps: Inspect filters and coil face for blockage
Compare fan speed and SAT response to normal windows
Check for abnormal fan operation or belt slip (if applicable)
resolution_steps: Replace/clean filters and remove airflow obstructions
Clean coil face if blocked
Validate SAT response after airflow restoration
expected_post_fix_behavior: SAT should respond more strongly to cc_valve modulation
fan speed increases should no longer be needed to maintain control

fault_title: Zone Temperature Sensor Drift Upward (Control Appears Normal, Zones ‘Look Hot’)
symptoms: avg_zone_temp trends upward without corresponding degradation in sa_temp control
cc_valve behavior appears reasonable for sa_temp_sp tracking
complaints persist despite stable SAT control (per telemetry)

window_pattern.trend_notes: avg_zone_temp increases gradually; SAT tracks setpoint normally

likely_root_cause: Zone temperature sensor offset/drift (avg_zone_temp biased high).
verification_steps: Cross-check zone temperature reading with a reference thermometer
Compare avg_zone_temp trend to SAT stability
Check for known sensor calibration schedule
resolution_steps: Recalibrate zone sensor input
Replace sensor if drift persists after calibration
Validate zone feedback stability over subsequent windows
expected_post_fix_behavior: avg_zone_temp should stabilize and better reflect actual conditions
control actions should align with true comfort state

fault_title: Zone Temperature Sensor Drift Downward (Zones ‘Look Cold’, Overcooling Risk)
symptoms: avg_zone_temp trends downward while SAT control remains stable
cooling appears stronger than needed given zone feedback
control may continue cooling longer due to biased low zone temperature reading

window_pattern.trend_notes: avg_zone_temp decreases gradually; SAT continues tracking setpoint

likely_root_cause: Zone temperature sensor drift (avg_zone_temp biased low), misrepresenting actual comfort.
verification_steps: Validate zone temperature using independent measurement
Compare zone temperature trend to expected occupancy/load patterns
Review sensor calibration history
resolution_steps: Calibrate/replace affected zone sensor
Monitor avg_zone_temp alignment post-fix
Adjust control thresholds if needed after sensor correction
expected_post_fix_behavior: avg_zone_temp should reflect realistic zone conditions without monotonic drift
cooling runtime should reduce if previously driven by biased feedback

fault_title: Faster Zone Sensor Drift (Detected Late, Persistent Comfort Complaints)
symptoms: avg_zone_temp shifts noticeably over a short period (accelerated drift)
SAT control remains largely normal; anomalies mainly appear in zone feedback
operators see inconsistent comfort signals vs equipment behavior

window_pattern.trend_notes: zone temperature feedback changes faster than expected; equipment signals remain stable

likely_root_cause: Zone temperature sensor experiencing accelerated drift (faulty sensing element or wiring issue).
verification_steps: Spot-check zone temperature against reference across multiple locations
Inspect sensor wiring/termination for intermittent issues
Compare adjacent zone readings if available
resolution_steps: Replace suspect zone sensor
Verify stable zone readings post-replacement
Reassess zone control effectiveness after correction
expected_post_fix_behavior: avg_zone_temp should be stable and consistent over time
control actions should better align with reported comfort
